title: Authors and Citation
text: Claire de Rosamel. Author. Alain Quartier-la-Tente. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: de Rosamel C, Quartier-la-Tente (2023). tvCoef: Linear Time-Varying Coefficient Models. R package version 0.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {tvCoef: Linear Time-Varying Coefficient Models},   author = {Claire {de Rosamel} and Alain Quartier-la-Tente},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

title: Linear Time-Varying Coefficient Models
text: goal tvCoef …

title: Breakdates regression — bp.lms
text: Computes many regressions breakup dates within global model

title: Breakdates regression — bp.lms
code: bp.lms(x, data, left = TRUE, break_dates, tvlm = FALSE, ...)

title: Breakdates regression — bp.lms
text: x lm object. global regression model data data frame, list environment containing variables model left logical. default set TRUE, .e. breakdate end date submodel break_dates optional, indicate breakup dates known tvlm default set FALSE. Indicates model run sub data. FALSE means lm run.

title: Breakdates regression — bp.lms
text: Returns element class bp.lms. list containing following elements : model computed models, class lm tvlm according parameter specified start start date time serie end end date time serie frequency frequency time serie breakdates list breakup dates left parameter specified tvlm parameter specified

title: Break data — break_data
text: Splits database according one () date

title: Break data — break_data
text: x mts split break_dates date(s) want divide data left logical. default set TRUE, .e. breakdate end date subcolumn

title: Break data — break_data
text: mts containing many times data columns breakdates

title: French GDP — gdp
text: French GDP

title: French GDP — gdp
text: quarterly ts object 1977Q2 2023Q1 (TODO).

title: French GDP — gdp
text: INSEE

title: Get data function — get_data
text: Retrieves data used model

title: Get data function — get_data
code: get_data(model, ...)  # S3 method for lm get_data(model, start, ...)  # S3 method for dynlm get_data(model, ...)  # S3 method for tvlm get_data(model, end, frequency, ...)  # S3 method for bp.lms get_data(model, ...)  # S3 method for piecereg get_data(model, ...)

title: Get data function — get_data
text: model model whose data want

title: Get elements of rmse_prev — get_rmse
text: Get elements rmse_prev

title: Get elements of rmse_prev — get_rmse
code: get_lm_coef(model)  get_tvlm_coef(model, date, variable)  get_tvlm_bw(model)  get_rmse_bw_small(model, ...)  get_coeff_plot(model, date, variable, titre = NULL)

title: Get elements of rmse_prev — get_rmse
text: model result rmse_prev fonction date date want tvlm coefficients variable integer. variable want coefficients given date

title: Get elements of rmse_prev — get_rmse
text: get_lm_coeff allows get coefficients linear regression prediction models get_tvlm_coeff allows get coefficients variable certain date local regression prediction models get_tvlm_bw allows get bandwidth local regression prediction models get_rmse_bw_small allows get rmse linear, local piecewise regression prediction models, bandwidth prediction model different 20. get_coeff_plot plot get_tvlm_coeff certain variable certain date, get_lm_coeff variable bandwidth prediction models, thanks get_tvlm_bw. also highlights bandwidth equal 20.

title: Hansen Test — hansen.test
text: Performs Hansen test

title: Hansen Test — hansen.test
text: x lm object. var variables used joint test. default variable used. sigma logical indicating joint test include variance

title: Hansen Test — hansen.test
text: Perform Hansen test, indicates variance model, global model coefficients variable within model likely unstable time. HO : coefficient/model stable time.

title: Hansen Test — hansen.test
text: Bruce E Hansen "Testing parameter instability linear models". Journal policy Modeling (1992)

title: Hansen Table — hansen_table
text: Hansen Table

title: Hansen Table — hansen_table
text: object class data.frame 20 rows 7 columns.

title: Last coefficients function — last_coef
text: Get last coefficients lm tvLM models.

title: Last coefficients function — last_coef
text: x 'tvlm' 'lm' object

what: Computes regression on fixed window — lm_fenetre_fixe
title: Computes regression on fixed window — lm_fenetre_fixe
text: Computes regression fixed window

title: Computes regression on fixed window — lm_fenetre_fixe
Computes regression on fixed window — lm_fenetre_fixe
text: formula formula object data time series data

title: Computes regression on fixed window — lm_fenetre_fixe
text: Return object class "lmffixe". Return models, can extract usual coefficients, residuals, fitted.values. divisor chosen function (arbitrary middle one), period, .e. length sub models, frequency data.

what: Fixed and variable coefficients regressions — lm_fixed_coeff
title: Fixed and variable coefficients regressions — lm_fixed_coeff
text: Computes different types regressions coefficients fixed others allowed vary

title: Fixed and variable coefficients regressions — lm_fixed_coeff
Fixed and variable coefficients regressions — lm_fixed_coeff
text: formula formula object. data time series data. var_fixes chosen variables whose coefficients allowed vary time

title: Fixed and variable coefficients regressions — lm_fixed_coeff
text: global_model simple lm model linear_reg simple lm model fixed coefficients piecewise_reg bp.lms model fixed coefficients tv_reg tvlm model fixed coefficients

title: Residual effect regression — lm_residual_effect
text: Checks residual effect model

title: Residual effect regression — lm_residual_effect
text: x lm object var variables residuals regressed. default use cancel explained variable

text: Business Surveys

title: Business Surveys — manufacturing
text: INSEE, Banque de France

what: Detect Fixed or Moving Coefficients — moving_coefficients
title: Detect Fixed or Moving Coefficients — moving_coefficients
text: Functions test coefficient fixed moving according Hansen test (hansen.test())

title: Detect Fixed or Moving Coefficients — moving_coefficients
code: moving_coefficients(   x,   a = c(5, 1, 2.5, 7.5, 10, 20),   sigma = FALSE,   intercept = TRUE )  fixed_coefficients(   x,   a = c(5, 1, 2.5, 7.5, 10, 20),   sigma = FALSE,   intercept = TRUE )

title: Detect Fixed or Moving Coefficients — moving_coefficients
text: x lm object. level sigma logical indicating joint test include variance intercept boolean indicating intercept consider moving coefficient least one variable moving.

title: Detect Fixed or Moving Coefficients — moving_coefficients
text: NULL variable selected, otherwise order variables.

title: Piecewise regression — piece_reg
text: Computes one global linear regression, splitted data

title: Piecewise regression — piece_reg
code: piece_reg(   x,   break_dates = NULL,   var_fixes = NULL,   tvlm = FALSE,   bw = NULL,   left = TRUE,   ... )

title: Piecewise regression — piece_reg
text: x lm object, separate data break_dates optional, indicate breakdates known. default set NULL

title: Piecewise regression — piece_reg
text: Returns element class lm

title: Piecewise regression — piece_reg
text: Computes possible breakdates filled . Uses function break_data run linear regression splitted data.

title: Plot best_ssm — plot.best_ssm
text: Plot explained variable fitted values computed smoothed filtering states.

title: Plot best_ssm — plot.best_ssm
code: # S3 method for best_ssm plot(x, choice = c("smoothed", "filtering"), ...)

title: Plot best_ssm — plot.best_ssm
text: x best_ssm object choice choose smoothed filtering

what: Extract data frame for lm_fixed_coeff — resid_lm_fixed
title: Extract data frame for lm_fixed_coeff — resid_lm_fixed
text: According parameter var_fixes, computes new explained variable, explained variable minus product estimated coefficients values fixed variables.

title: Extract data frame for lm_fixed_coeff — resid_lm_fixed
Extract data frame for lm_fixed_coeff — resid_lm_fixed
text: x lm model var_fixes list variables vary time according hansen.test

title: Extract data frame for lm_fixed_coeff — resid_lm_fixed
text: new environment explained variable named "fixed".

what: Computes RMSE of different models — rmse_prev
title: Computes RMSE of different models — rmse_prev
text: Computes 6 models : linear regression, piecewise regression (linear regression local regression), local regression (tvLM), piecewise regression fixed coefficients tvlm fixed coefficients. Computes 6 rmse residuals 6 others residuals predictions models.

title: Computes RMSE of different models — rmse_prev
code: rmse_prev(x, data, var_fixes = NULL, fixed_bw = FALSE, ...)  # S3 method for formula rmse_prev(x, data, var_fixes = NULL, fixed_bw = FALSE, ...)  # S3 method for lm rmse_prev(x, var_fixes = NULL, fixed_bw = FALSE, ...)

title: Computes RMSE of different models — rmse_prev
text: x object class formula lm, description model fitted, model . data ts object containing variables model. Necessary x formula. var_fixes variables model coefficients fixed models fixed coefficients. Obtained thanks hansen test. fixed_bw logical, default set FALSE. Indicates bandwidth computed prevision model, takes value bandwidth tvlm model. ... additional arguments

title: Computes RMSE of different models — rmse_prev
text: Returns object class prev list containing following elements : model list 6 explanatory models prevision list 6 predictions 6 previous models rmse list 2 computed rmse, sample sample

title: Computes RMSE of different models — rmse_prev
text: additional arguments, parameters date period can informed. soos_prev default respectively set 10 1. estimate prevision models, function soos_prev used. previsions two models fixed coefficients, fixed coefficients re-estimated date, bp.lms tvLM run moving variables.

title: Root mean squarred error — rmse_res
text: Root mean squarred error

title: Root mean squarred error — rmse_res
text: resid residuals vector rmse calculated

what: Out of sample prevision (or simulated out of sample) — soos_prev
title: Out of sample prevision (or simulated out of sample) — soos_prev
text: sample prevision (simulated sample)

title: Out of sample prevision (or simulated out of sample) — soos_prev
code: soos_prev(model, date = 28, period = 1, ...)  # S3 method for lm soos_prev(model, date = 28, period = 1, data, ...)  # S3 method for tvlm soos_prev(   model,   data_est = NULL,   date = 28,   period = 1,   fixed_bw = FALSE,   bw = NULL,   end,   frequency,   ... )  # S3 method for bp.lms soos_prev(   model,   data_est = NULL,   date = 28,   period = 1,   data,   fixed_bw = FALSE,   bw = NULL,   ... )

title: Out of sample prevision (or simulated out of sample) — soos_prev
text: model object used select method date choose want start revision process start date. default set 10. period choose many values want move forward. default set 1. ... arguments

title: Out of sample prevision (or simulated out of sample) — soos_prev
text: soos_prev returns object class revision, models class lm tvlm. object class bplm returns previsions residuals . object class revision list containing following elements : model models used forecast debut date chosen earlier intervalle period chosen earlier end_dates vector end date models frequency frequency data prevision forecast residuals errors forecast

title: State space model — ssm_lm
text: Computes state space model one equation. Starting simple lm model, build state space model run . Use rjd3sts packages.

title: State space model — ssm_lm
code: ssm_lm(   x,   trend = FALSE,   var_intercept = 0,   var_trend = 0,   var_slope = 0,   var_variables = 0,   fixed_var_intercept = TRUE,   fixed_var_trend = TRUE,   fixed_var_variables = TRUE,   ...,   remove_last_dummies = FALSE )

title: State space model — ssm_lm
text: trend trend var_intercept, var_slope variance intercept slope (used trend = TRUE). var_variables variance variables: can either single value (variance variables) vector specifying variance. fixed_var_intercept, fixed_var_trend, fixed_var_variables logical indicating variance fixed estimated. model lm dynlm model

title: State space model — ssm_lm
text: Returns list containing : smoothed_states \(E[a_t|y_0,\dots,y_n]\) smoothed_stdev \(V[a_t|y_0,\dots,y_n]\) filtering_states \(E[a_t|y_0,\dots,y_{t-1}]\) filtering_stdev \(V[a_t|y_0,\dots,y_{t-1}]\) parameters estimation parameters data data used original model

title: Best state space model — ssm_lm_best
text: Computes 25 state space models, using ssm_lm different parameters : fixed_var_intercept fixed_var_variables either TRUE FALSE, var_intercept var_variables taking 0.01, 100 0 (associated parameters set TRUE)

title: Best state space model — ssm_lm_best
text: model lm dynlm model

title: Best state space model — ssm_lm_best
text: Return object class best_ssm, list containing : rmse_best_model_smoothed gives rmse best model smoothed states rmse_best_model_filtering gives rmse best model filtering states best_model_smoothed entire best model smoothed states best_model_filtering entire best model filtering states model 25 models rmse list 3 : computed rmse

title: Best state space model — ssm_lm_best
text: can give different models smoothed filtering states.

what: Best out of sample state space model — ssm_lm_best_oos
title: Best out of sample state space model — ssm_lm_best_oos
text: Computes 25 state space models, using ssm_lm_oos different parameters : fixed_var_intercept fixed_var_variables either TRUE FALSE, var_intercept var_variables taking 0.01, 100 0 (associated parameters set TRUE). 25 conbinations parameters ssm_lm_best

title: Best out of sample state space model — ssm_lm_best_oos
Best out of sample state space model — ssm_lm_best_oos
text: model lm dynlm model

title: Best out of sample state space model — ssm_lm_best_oos
text: rmse_best_model_filtering gives rmse best model sample prevision best_model_filtering best model model 25 models rmse_filtering 25 rmse

title: Best out of sample state space model — ssm_lm_best_oos
text: can give different models smoothed filtering states.

what: Out of sample prevision of state space model — ssm_lm_oos
title: Out of sample prevision of state space model — ssm_lm_oos
text: Computes sample previsions given state space model. Unlike ssm_lm can manage dummies.

title: Out of sample prevision of state space model — ssm_lm_oos
code: ssm_lm_oos(   model,   trend = FALSE,   var_intercept = 0,   var_trend = 0,   var_variables = 0,   fixed_var_intercept = TRUE,   fixed_var_variables = TRUE,   date = 28,   ... )

title: Out of sample prevision of state space model — ssm_lm_oos
text: model lm dynlm model trend trend var_intercept ?? var_variables ?? fixed_var_intercept logical fixed_var_variables logical

title: Out of sample prevision of state space model — ssm_lm_oos
text: Returns coefficients variables residual
